abstract: News analysis; pronounced shift in cancer research is under way, with expert groups proposing less screening for prostate, breast and cervical cancer; experts say snowballing evidence shows that number of cases that can be helped by early detection through widespread screening is small, and emphasize that screening comes with harms as well as benefits.
snippet: Cancer experts say a snowballing body of evidence shows that the number of cases that can be helped by early detection through widespread screening are small in number.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

lead_paragraph: Cancer experts say a snowballing body of evidence shows that the number of cases that can be helped by early detection through widespread screening are small in number.

headline.main: Considering When It Might Be Best Not to Know About Cancer
headline.print_headline: Considering When It Might Be Best Not to Know About Cancer
headline.seo: Cancer Screening May Be More Popular Than Useful
